<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29205).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [theuni](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29205#pullrequestreview-1810905286), [TheCharlatan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29205#issuecomment-1883045460) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29185](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29185) (build: remove `--enable-lto` by fanquake)
* [#28876](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28876) (build: Fix LTO functionality by hebasto)
* [#28710](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28710) (Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Unrelated to this PR, but this line is busted. gcc/clang take the last `-O` option, so `-O0` is just clobbering the `-Og` here.
diff_hunk:
@@ -869,12 +872,6 @@ if test "$use_lcov" = "yes"; then
     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage linker flag does not work])])
   AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([--coverage],[CORE_CXXFLAGS="$CORE_CXXFLAGS --coverage"],
     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage flag does not work])])
-  dnl If coverage is enabled, and the user hasn't overridden CXXFLAGS, clear
-  dnl them, to prevent autoconfs "-g -O2" being added. Otherwise we'd end up
-  dnl with "--coverage -Og -O0 -g -O2".
-  if test "$CXXFLAGS_overridden" = "no"; then
-  CXXFLAGS=""
-  fi
   CORE_CXXFLAGS="$CORE_CXXFLAGS -Og -O0"

@@ -869,12 +872,6 @@ if test "$use_lcov" = "yes"; then
     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage linker flag does not work])])
   AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([--coverage],[CORE_CXXFLAGS="$CORE_CXXFLAGS --coverage"],
     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage flag does not work])])
-  dnl If coverage is enabled, and the user hasn't overridden CXXFLAGS, clear
-  dnl them, to prevent autoconfs "-g -O2" being added. Otherwise we'd end up
-  dnl with "--coverage -Og -O0 -g -O2".
-  if test "$CXXFLAGS_overridden" = "no"; then
-  CXXFLAGS=""
-  fi
   CORE_CXXFLAGS="$CORE_CXXFLAGS -Og -O0"

body: @theuni If you want I can also just include a fix for this in here, while we are sorting out flags.

@@ -869,12 +872,6 @@ if test "$use_lcov" = "yes"; then

body: Would be good to fix this here imo.

body: I've pushed up a commit to do so.
diff_hunk:
@@ -869,12 +872,6 @@ if test "$use_lcov" = "yes"; then
     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage linker flag does not work])])

     [AC_MSG_ERROR([lcov testing requested but --coverage flag does not work])])

-  CXXFLAGS=""
-  fi
   CORE_CXXFLAGS="$CORE_CXXFLAGS -Og -O0"

body: Looks good, thanks. Looking at 7b00595d335915dc2bf856e3569115996381a402 it's clear that this is what was intended.
